name: Earthjustice
mission: Stay informed on how we hold accountable those who break our environmental laws.
programs: End the extraction and burning of fossil fuels
Secure clean air and water as rights for all
Remove toxic chemicals and products from our daily lives
Farm sustainably for healthy lives, lands, climate
theoryOfChange: Earthjustice has a published 'Commitment To Justice' framework. This framework, developed by their CJI team, outlines a clear vision for advancing justice in their work, conceiving an 'Ecosystem of Justice' that aims to achieve a truly democratic multi-racial society, incorporating and serving all people and the planet. It emphasizes that every staff member has the power and responsibility to advance justice in their interactions, choices, and work. Their approach involves critical inquiry to understand their impact internally and externally. Additionally, Earthjustice's 'Our Work' section details their goals, such as ending fossil fuel extraction, securing clean air and water, and building a justice-centered environmental movement, and describes their key strategies to achieve these, including using legal tools and partnering with communities.

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Earthjustice shows strong impact and moderate alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: https://earthjustice.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: Earthjustice operates programs such as The Wild and Healthy Communities and maintains a program expense ratio of 80.2%.
The organization reported total revenue of $125,960,142, fundraising efficiency of $0.12 per $1 raised, and working capital of 19.3 months.
The organization offers various donation methods for general charitable giving and sadaqah.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Earthjustice earns a 65/100 reflecting its exceptional financial health and specialized legal impact, though its alignment score is moderated by its focus on broad advocacy rather than direct service to Muslim-specific causes.
areas_for_improvement: High cost per beneficiary due to the resource-intensive nature of federal and appellate litigation
Limited direct alignment with specific Muslim community donor priorities or traditional sadaqah-focused humanitarian aid

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is considered medium (27/50) because while the cause of environmental justice is urgent, the organization's focus on U.S. legal advocacy presents a low specific fit for donors seeking traditional Islamic charitable frameworks [1][3]. Contributions are processed as general sadaqah for those interested in environmental stewardship [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high capacity-building impact by providing pro bono legal representation that would otherwise be cost-prohibitive, backed by a program expense ratio of 80.2% [1][2]. While the cost per beneficiary is high at $118,249.374, this reflects the complexity of multi-year environmental law cases and systemic policy shifts [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Earthjustice serves as a premier nonprofit public interest law organization, leveraging legal expertise and strategic partnerships to protect the environment and public health.
strengths: High financial stability with 19.3 months of working capital available to sustain long-term legal battles
Strong fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.12 to raise every $1 in contributions
Commitment to program services, maintaining a program expense ratio of 80.2%
baseline_narrative.summary: Founded as a legal powerhouse for the environmental movement, Earthjustice operates major programs including The Wild and Healthy Communities to defend natural resources and human rights [1]. The organization reported a total revenue of $125,960,142, utilizing its legal capacity to represent clients at no cost in high-stakes environmental litigation [2].

all_citations.quote: We represent our clients free of charge

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Earthjustice earns a 65/100 reflecting its exceptional financial health and specialized legal impact, though its alignment score is moderated by its focus on broad advocacy rather than direct service to Muslim-specific causes.

areas_for_improvement.context: Due to the resource-intensive nature of legal work, the <cite id="14">cost per beneficiary is approximately $118,249</cite>, which is high compared to direct-service humanitarian aid.
The organization lacks a <cite id="15">dedicated sadaqah or zakat-related outreach strategy</cite>, which may limit its appeal to faith-based donors looking for specific religious alignment.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization maintains high governance standards with a fully independent board and audited financials.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization mitigates this by focusing on systemic changes that protect millions of people through a single legal victory.
risk_factors: <cite id="14">Resource-intensive litigation model</cite> results in high per-beneficiary costs.
case_against.summary: The primary concern for donors is the <cite id="14">high cost of legal advocacy</cite> and the lack of direct humanitarian service.

confidence.notes: Strong financial and governance data available.

known_gaps: Not fully rated by Charity Navigator

alignment.explanation: While the cause is urgent, there is <cite id="15">limited direct alignment</cite> with Muslim donor fit as the organization does not have specific faith-based programming.
alignment.improvement: The organization could improve alignment by <cite id="15">clearly stating how its environmental justice work</cite> serves underserved Muslim-majority regions or populations.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust Earthjustice due to its <cite id="11">100% independent board</cite> and its <cite id="13">Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>. The organization has been <cite id="10">operating since 1971</cite>, demonstrating long-term institutional stability.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the organization could publish more detailed <cite id="14">impact metrics regarding specific litigation outcomes</cite> to justify the high cost per beneficiary.

impact.explanation: Operations are efficient with a <cite id="4">80.2% program expense ratio</cite> and <cite id="8">high working capital</cite> to ensure program continuity.
impact.improvement: If reserves remain significantly above policy targets, the organization should <cite id="8">document triggers for planned deployment</cite> of these funds into new legal cases.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Verified outcomes and strong theory of change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Funds partner organizations to strengthen the broader environmental movement.

rich_narrative.headline: Earthjustice serves as a premier nonprofit public interest law organization, leveraging legal expertise and strategic partnerships to protect the environment and public health.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize systemic legal change and environmental protection over direct humanitarian aid and are comfortable with a long-term advocacy horizon.
donor_motivations: Want to use the legal system to protect the environment
Value long-term institutional stability and governance
Care about climate change and clean water as fundamental rights
Prefer funding expert-led legal battles rather than direct service
giving_considerations: Donations support high-cost legal experts and appellate litigation
Impact is measured in policy changes and court victories rather than individual aid packages
The organization has a very large asset base and high reserves
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those who prefer low-overhead, direct-service humanitarian relief like food or medical aid.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization has verified outcomes and a strong theory of change, though the nature of legal work makes traditional RCTs difficult.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Earthjustice uses the power of law to preserve wild lands, protect wildlife, and ensure healthy communities by holding polluters and government agencies accountable in court.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence in legal advocacy ensures that litigation strategies are actually resulting in policy protections and environmental preservation.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While the organization has high reserves, the scale of environmental legal challenges provides significant opportunities for expanded litigation.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Global with focus on USA, South Africa, and South America

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="8">exceptionally high working capital</cite> compared to the peer median.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on advocacy and legal action
similar_organizations.name: Sierra Club Foundation

similar_organizations.differentiator: Stronger focus on scientific research alongside advocacy
similar_organizations.name: Union of Concerned Scientists

similar_organizations.differentiator: More focused on grassroots climate activism
similar_organizations.name: 350.org

strengths.detail: The organization maintains <cite id="8">19.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer to sustain multi-year legal battles without interruption.
Earthjustice demonstrates strong fiscal discipline, spending only <cite id="9">$0.12 to raise every $1 in contributions</cite>.
With a history <cite id="10">dating back to 1971</cite>, the organization has over five decades of experience in environmental law and advocacy.

strengths_deep_dive: Earthjustice's strength lies in its specialized capacity-building model, which allows it to take on complex federal and appellate litigation that would otherwise be cost-prohibitive for local communities. This is supported by a robust <cite id="11">independent board with 100% independent members</cite>, ensuring high standards of governance. Financially, the organization is well-positioned for growth, showing a <cite id="12">3-year revenue CAGR of 4.7%</cite>. Its transparency is further validated by a <cite id="13">Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, signaling a commitment to sharing organizational data and outcomes.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 1971 as a legal powerhouse for the environmental movement, Earthjustice operates as a premier nonprofit public interest law organization that <cite id="1">represents clients at no cost</cite> in high-stakes litigation. The organization wields the power of law to <cite id="2">defend natural resources and human rights</cite> through major programs such as The Wild and Healthy Communities. In the 2023 tax year, Earthjustice reported a <cite id="3">total revenue of $125,960,142</cite>, reflecting a stable financial base for its long-term advocacy efforts. The organization maintains a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 80.2%</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of its funding is directed toward its core mission of environmental protection. Beyond litigation, Earthjustice engages in strategic partnerships to <cite id="5">secure clean air and water as rights for all</cite> and build a justice-centered environmental movement. Its impact is further amplified through digital engagement, reaching <cite id="6">100 million views on social media</cite> platforms to raise awareness for climate issues. While its primary focus is legal advocacy, the organization also supports educational initiatives, with <cite id="7">37,075 students using its curriculum</cite> to learn about environmental stewardship.
